content.question: <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> are nucleic acids that can store biological information based on the sequence of their nucleotide monomers. Figure 1 shows a short segment of each of the two types of nucleic acids. Which of the following best describes a structural difference between <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> contains four types of nitrogenous bases, whereas <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> contains only two types of nitrogenous bases.

The backbone of <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> contains deoxyribose, whereas the backbone of <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> contains ribose.

A <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> molecule is composed of two parallel strands with the same <math alttext="5 prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="3 prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> directionality, whereas an <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> molecule is composed of only one <math alttext="5 prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="3 prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> strand.

Phosphate groups provide rigidity to <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>, but <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> is flexible and contains no phosphate groups.

content.answer: The backbone of <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> contains deoxyribose, whereas the backbone of <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> contains ribose.

skill.text: 2.A: Describe characteristics of visual representations of biological concepts and processes.
